availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Warren (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and sgt 7th KY Cav USA)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of James L. Warren and Elizabeth Warren. Married to Mary H. Shultz Warren in Aberdeen, Ohio, on June 1, 1859. Father of infant Warren. Student in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant from August 16, 1862. Reported as deserted from Richmond, Kentucky, on August 30, 1862. Farmer in Bath County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Division 2, p. 19B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 190.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000216816, p. 16.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 206-07.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 85.
